p.s: ( M.D. , FAAP ) is a professor of the Practice in the Suzanne Dworak-Peck School of Social Work and Pediatrics at the University of Southern California and Children 's Hospital Los Angeles and director at the National Center for School Crisis and Bereavement .

Schonfeld attended
Boston University School of Medicine
and Boston University College of Liberal Arts from which he graduated with B.A. ( Summa Cum Laude ) and M.D. ( Magna Cum Laude ) along with
Phi Beta Kappa
and Pediatrics Award - all in 1983 .
[ 1 ]

Following graduation , he pursued residency in pediatrics at the
Children 's Hospital of Philadelphia
at which he served until 1986 .

He quit the residency following the advise of his mentor there , who told him that he should have pursued behavioral pediatrics fellowship after Schonfeld complained to him that he have learned how to take care of children 's illnesses , but he did n't go into pediatrics because he loves illnesses .
[ 2 ]

He then pursued fellowship in behavioral and developmental pediatrics with the
University of Maryland , Baltimore
from which he graduated in 1989 .
[ 1 ]

Immediately after University of Maryland , David Schonfeld joined the faculty at
Yale School of Medicine
as an assistant professor of pediatrics , a position which he kept until 1995 .

He then relocated to the
Yale New Haven Hospital
, where he served as its director until 1998 and from 1990 until 2005 maintained the same position at its Lead Program .
[ 1 ]

When
Gulf War
broke out in 1991 , Schonfeld participated at a meeting regarding children cope with war at the
Yale Child Study Center
, a department of the Yale School of Medicine .

There , he found out that children at
New Haven , Connecticut
are more impacted by city violence then war .
[ 2 ]

In an interview with Nicole Wise of
The New York Times
in 1992 , Dr. Schonfeld had suggested that parents should n't be afraid to talk to their children about
AIDS
and should start explaining it to children who are as early as 3-4 year old .
[ 3 ]

After
September 11 attacks
, he educated fellow teachers ' unions , such as the
American Federation of Teachers
, on how to help children to cope with a loss of their loved one .

In the study that was conducted by him , it was revealed that only 7 % of teachers had received training and only 3 % of
school districts
offer such courses .
[ 2 ]

In 2005 , David Schonfeld had received funding from the September 11th Children 's Fund to establish National Center for School Crisis and Bereavement at the
University of Southern California School of Social Work
and several years prior to it , he obtained additional funding from the
New York Life Foundation
to expand the center and construct the
Coalition to Support Grieving Students
.
[ 2 ]
From 2005 to 2012

Schonfeld was the Thelma and Jack Rubinstein Professor of Pediatrics and director of the Division of Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics
[ 4 ]
at
Cincinnati Children 's Hospital Medical Center
.

From 2006 to 2015 he was a visiting professor at the
University of Eastern Piedmont
and at the
Vrije Universiteit Brussel
.

When the
shooting at Aurora , Colorado
happened in 2012 , David Schonfeld was invited to speak at the school the next day .
[ 5 ]

From 2013 to 2015 he was pediatrician-in-chief at the
St. Christopher 's Hospital for Children
and chairman and professor of pediatrics at
Drexel University College of Medicine
.
[ 1 ]

Upon expiration of his position at Drexel University , he joined the faculty of the
University of Southern California
and its Suzanne Dworak-Peck School of Social Work and Pediatrics .
[ 2 ]

In 2015 he spoke on the Healthy Children Radio regarding natural disasters and gun violence and how to cope with them .
[ 6 ]

In 2016 he ,
Steven Krug
(
Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine
) and
Daniel Fagbuyi
(
George Washington University School of Medicine
) had compiled a report in which they criticized the U.S. government for not providing enough funding for the medical needs of children during public health emergencies .
[ 7 ]

In March that year he spoke at a free community forum to discuss childhood trauma and crisis of the Our Lady of the Lake Children 's Hospital following the
2016 shooting of Baton Rouge police officers
.
[ 8 ]

Following the
2017 Las Vegas shooting
, David Schonfeld and
Marleen Wong
had traveled to
Las Vegas
where they addressed issues on
post-traumatic stress disorder
,
anxiety
and
grief
.
[ 9 ]

In 2018 , Dr. Schonfeld and the New York Life Foundation had launched Grief-Sensitive Schools Initiative which will train New York Life employees to deliver public speaking about grief in public schools .
[ 10 ]

When
Nipsey Hussle
died in 2019 , Schonfeld was quoted by
Fox News
saying , " People want to come together to support each other .
That 's really what makes us a community .

From 1993 to 1994 Schonfeld served on the Nominations Committee of the Society for Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics and from 1996 to 1999 was first chairman of the Research Committee at the same place .
From 1997 to 2000 he served as the first SDBP Liaison to the AAP Committee on Pediatric Research and until 2002 was the first SDBP Liaison to the Alliance for Health and Behavior Research .
From 1998 to 2002 Dr. Schonfeld served on the Executive Council and since 2000 he is a chair of the Trainee Manuscript Award Committee .
David Schonfeld also served on the Task Force on Terrorism from 2001 to 2004 and on the Committee on Resident Research Grants .

In addition , he is one of the initial members of the Subboard of Developmental Behavioral Pediatrics , as well as a member of the
American Pediatric Society
,
Society for Pediatric Research
, American Pediatric Association , and
American School Health Association
.
[ 12 ]

In 2007 , David Schonfeld became President of the Society for Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics .
[ 13 ]
and in May of same year served on an Executive Council of the same place .
[ 14 ]

From 2008 to 2010 he served on the Disaster Mental Health Subcommittee of the National Biodefense Science Board Federal Advisory Committee under
Homeland Security Presidential Directive 7
( formerly Presidential Policy Directive 21 )
[ 15 ]
and Scientific and Program Committee of the
International Pediatric Association
.

He also served on the National Commission on Children and Disasters from 2008 to 2011
[ 1 ]
and since 2009 serves as a member of the expert panel on the Child Development & Behavior Branch .
[ 16 ]

In 2013 , he was appointed to the Sandy Hook Advisory Commission by
Dannel Malloy
[ 17 ]
and in February that year became a chairman of the Department of Pediatrics at
Drexel University College of Medicine
.
[ 4 ]

Since 2017 he serves as a
benefactor
at the Society for Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics
[ 18 ]
and as its pediatrician-in-chief .
[ 19 ]

Since 2015 , David J. Schonfeld is on the
American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology
steering committee .
[ 20 ]

David Schonfeld serves on an
editorial board
of the
Journal of Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics
.
[ 21 ]

He was a co-author with
Thomas Demaria
on book chapters such as " Child & Disaster " and " Bereavement " .
[ 22 ]

Schonfeld have two grown up daughters
[ 23 ]
one of which is Kim .
[ 24 ]
